TopicTitle: How to build Gemini with MH?

Articles.Content:
Surpisingly, it's easier to build the Orion now then the Gemini.

As everyone knows, Gemini is missing a "easy nosecone", and thus requiring either 2 stack (at least) of either the Oscar tanks, or have ugly but more functional yellow RCS tanks... but that's not the worst.

What concern me is the "adapter module". Either one actually do it by function, and thus use the SM-18/Structure tube for the fuel, fuel cell and battery, or just radial attach them at one face of the 1.8 to 2.5 tank (which aside from being long, is also the only adapter) before letting the Mk2 capsule sit on the node. 

So what's everyone's opinion? I did see some examples of KerbalX, and all it does is to see the further indicate no one knows how to build a Gemini "properly".

(I moved my thread to hear, since this is more for opinion then geniune "how to build"
There is a whole section of the forums for discussing all things Making History, including a discussion on the Gemini & service module etc:

I first tried to build a more realistically-shaped Gemini using the tapered 1.875-to-2.5 meter fuel tank adapter...but when it came time to build a Titan II rocket for it, all the Making History parts that are analogs for the Titan engines are 1.875-meter size...so that dictated the choice of the straight service module part for my Gemini.
